channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Analysis of Thai Capital Market Linkages: Part III. Vine Copula and Monte Carlo Value-at-Risk/Expected Shortfall
item.description: Analytically thorough understanding of financial-market dynamics is fundamental to the promotion of capital-market innovation, efficiency, and resilience; innovative, efficient, and resilient capital market, in turn, is fundamental to the sustainable economic development of the nation and the robust financial stability of its economy.

item.title: A Stochastic Proximal Polyak Step Size
item.description: Developing a proximal variant of SPS is particularly important, since SPS requires a lower bound of the objective function to work well.

item.title: Causal Triplet: An Open Challenge for Intervention-centric Causal Representation Learning
item.description: Recent years have seen a surge of interest in learning high-level causal representations from low-level image pairs under interventions.

item.title: Multimodal Deep Learning
item.description: This book is the result of a seminar in which we reviewed multimodal approaches and attempted to create a solid overview of the field, starting with the current state-of-the-art approaches in the two subfields of Deep Learning individually.

item.title: Sharpening Ponzi Schemes Detection on Ethereum with Machine Learning
item.description: Blockchain technology has been successfully exploited for deploying new economic applications.

item.title: A Dataset of Kurdish (Sorani) Named Entities -- An Amendment to Kurdish-BLARK Named Entities
item.description: Named Entity Recognition (NER) is one of the essential applications of Natural Language Processing (NLP).

item.title: Density-based clustering with fully-convolutional networks for crowd flow detection from drones
item.description: To this end, we propose a crowd flow detection method for video sequences shot by a drone.

item.title: Self-Supervised Correction Learning for Semi-Supervised Biomedical Image Segmentation
item.description: Since the two tasks rely on similar feature information, the unlabeled data effectively enhances the representation of the network to the lesion regions and further improves the segmentation performance.

item.title: SlideVQA: A Dataset for Document Visual Question Answering on Multiple Images
item.description: Visual question answering on document images that contain textual, visual, and layout information, called document VQA, has received much attention recently.

item.title: Adaptive Context Selection for Polyp Segmentation
item.description: To tackle these issues, we propose an adaptive context selection based encoder-decoder framework which is composed of Local Context Attention (LCA) module, Global Context Module (GCM) and Adaptive Selection Module (ASM).

item.title: ImMesh: An Immediate LiDAR Localization and Meshing Framework
item.description: This voxel-wise meshing operation is delicately designed for the purpose of efficiency; it first performs a dimension reduction by projecting 3D points to a 2D local plane contained in the voxel, and then executes the meshing operation with pull, commit and push steps for incremental reconstruction of triangle facets.

item.title: DEA-Net: Single image dehazing based on detail-enhanced convolution and content-guided attention
item.description: In this paper, a detail-enhanced attention block (DEAB) consisting of the detail-enhanced convolution (DEConv) and the content-guided attention (CGA) is proposed to boost the feature learning for improving the dehazing performance.

item.title: Improvement of Computational Performance of Evolutionary AutoML in a Heterogeneous Environment
item.description: Resource-intensive computations are a major factor that limits the effectiveness of automated machine learning solutions.

item.title: Adversarial Adaptation for French Named Entity Recognition
item.description: We propose a Transformer-based NER approach for French, using adversarial adaptation to similar domain or general corpora to improve feature extraction and enable better generalization.

item.title: Why is the State of Neural Network Pruning so Confusing? On the Fairness, Comparison Setup, and Trainability in Network Pruning
item.description: The state of neural network pruning has been noticed to be unclear and even confusing for a while, largely due to "a lack of standardized benchmarks and metrics" [3].

item.title: Lesion-aware Dynamic Kernel for Polyp Segmentation
item.description: Automatic and accurate polyp segmentation plays an essential role in early colorectal cancer diagnosis.

item.title: Machine-learning Analysis of Opioid Use Disorder Informed by MOR, DOR, KOR, NOR and ZOR-Based Interactome Networks
item.description: Despite that a few pharmacological agents have been approved for OUD treatment, the efficacy of said agents for OUD requires further improvement in order to provide safer and more effective pharmacological and psychosocial treatments.

item.title: Head-Free Lightweight Semantic Segmentation with Linear Transformer
item.description: On the ADE20K dataset, our model achieves 41. 8 mIoU and 4. 6 GFLOPs, which is 4. 4 mIoU higher than Segformer, with 45% less GFLOPs.

item.title: GPT as Knowledge Worker: A Zero-Shot Evaluation of (AI)CPA Capabilities
item.description: The global economy is increasingly dependent on knowledge workers to meet the needs of public and private organizations.

item.title: Diving Deep into Modes of Fact Hallucinations in Dialogue Systems
item.description: Knowledge Graph(KG) grounded conversations often use large pre-trained models and usually suffer from fact hallucination.

item.title: Synthetic data generation method for data-free knowledge distillation in regression neural networks
item.description: Knowledge distillation is the technique of compressing a larger neural network, known as the teacher, into a smaller neural network, known as the student, while still trying to maintain the performance of the larger neural network as much as possible.

item.title: Fast spline detection in high density microscopy data
item.description: Computer-aided analysis of biological microscopy data has seen a massive improvement with the utilization of general-purpose deep learning techniques.

item.title: A prediction and behavioural analysis of machine learning methods for modelling travel mode choice
item.description: The answer to this question goes beyond simple predictive performance, and is instead a balance of many factors, including behavioural interpretability and explainability, computational complexity, and data efficiency.

item.title: AdaPoinTr: Diverse Point Cloud Completion with Adaptive Geometry-Aware Transformers
item.description: In this paper, we present a new method that reformulates point cloud completion as a set-to-set translation problem and design a new model, called PoinTr, which adopts a Transformer encoder-decoder architecture for point cloud completion.

item.title: Heterogeneous Tri-stream Clustering Network
item.description: Contrastive deep clustering has recently gained significant attention with its ability of joint contrastive learning and clustering via deep neural networks.

item.title: pyssam -- a Python library for statistical modelling of biomedical shape and appearance
item.description: pyssam is a Python library for creating statistical shape and appearance models (SSAMs) for biological (and other) shapes such as bones, lungs or other organs.

item.title: AdaptSLAM: Edge-Assisted Adaptive SLAM with Resource Constraints via Uncertainty Minimization
item.description: Edge computing is increasingly proposed as a solution for reducing resource consumption of mobile devices running simultaneous localization and mapping (SLAM) algorithms, with most edge-assisted SLAM systems assuming the communication resources between the mobile device and the edge server to be unlimited, or relying on heuristics to choose the information to be transmitted to the edge.

item.title: Multi-Scanner Canine Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma Histopathology Dataset
item.description: Additionally, to quantify the inherent scanner-induced domain shift, we train a tumor segmentation network on each scanner subset and evaluate the performance both in- and cross-domain.

item.title: SensePOLAR: Word sense aware interpretability for pre-trained contextual word embeddings
item.description: To address this limitation, we present SensePOLAR, an extension of the original POLAR framework that enables word-sense aware interpretability for pre-trained contextual word embeddings.

item.title: WuYun: Exploring hierarchical skeleton-guided melody generation using knowledge-enhanced deep learning
item.description: Although deep learning has revolutionized music generation, existing methods for structured melody generation follow an end-to-end left-to-right note-by-note generative paradigm and treat each note equally.

item.title: Optirank: classification for RNA-Seq data with optimal ranking reference genes
item.description: On those real tasks, optirank performs at least as well as the vanilla logistic regression on classical ranks, while producing sparser solutions.

item.title: Multimodal Inverse Cloze Task for Knowledge-based Visual Question Answering
item.description: We present a new pre-training method, Multimodal Inverse Cloze Task, for Knowledge-based Visual Question Answering about named Entities (KVQAE).

item.title: On the functional form of the radial acceleration relation
item.description: We apply a new method for learning equations from data -- Exhaustive Symbolic Regression (ESR) -- to late-type galaxy dynamics as encapsulated in the radial acceleration relation (RAR).

item.title: Fast conformational clustering of extensive molecular dynamics simulation data
item.description: In this approach we combine two dimensionality reduction algorithms (cc\_analysis and encodermap) with a density-based spatial clustering algorithm (HDBSCAN).

item.title: Adversarial Online Multi-Task Reinforcement Learning
item.description: We prove a minimax lower bound of $\Omega(K\sqrt{DSAH})$ on the regret of any learning algorithm and an instance-specific lower bound of $\Omega(\frac{K}{\lambda^2})$ in sample complexity for a class of uniformly-good cluster-then-learn algorithms.

item.title: Federated Learning under Heterogeneous and Correlated Client Availability
item.description: To this purpose, CA-Fed dynamically adapts the weight given to each client and may ignore clients with low availability and large correlation.

item.title: ClimaBench: A Benchmark Dataset For Climate Change Text Understanding in English
item.description: The topic of Climate Change (CC) has received limited attention in NLP despite its real world urgency.

item.title: TinyHD: Efficient Video Saliency Prediction with Heterogeneous Decoders using Hierarchical Maps Distillation
item.description: Video saliency prediction has recently attracted attention of the research community, as it is an upstream task for several practical applications.

item.title: LENet: Lightweight And Efficient LiDAR Semantic Segmentation Using Multi-Scale Convolution Attention
item.description: In this paper, we propose LENet, a lightweight and efficient projection-based LiDAR semantic segmentation network, which has an encoder-decoder architecture.

item.title: CARD: Semantic Segmentation with Efficient Class-Aware Regularized Decoder
item.description: Extensive experiments and ablation studies conducted on multiple benchmark datasets demonstrate that the proposed CAR can boost the accuracy of all baseline models by up to 2. 23% mIOU with superior generalization ability.

item.title: Fast Kinodynamic Planning on the Constraint Manifold with Deep Neural Networks
item.description: Motion planning is a mature area of research in robotics with many well-established methods based on optimization or sampling the state space, suitable for solving kinematic motion planning.

item.title: SHUNIT: Style Harmonization for Unpaired Image-to-Image Translation
item.description: Our SHUNIT generates a new style by harmonizing the target domain style retrieved from a class memory and an original source image style.

item.title: HADA: A Graph-based Amalgamation Framework in Image-text Retrieval
item.description: It is not easy to propose a new model with a novel architecture and intensively train it on a massive dataset with many GPUs to surpass many SOTA models, which are already available to use on the Internet.

item.title: Learning Continuous Mesh Representation with Spherical Implicit Surface
item.description: In this paper, we propose to learn a continuous representation for meshes with fixed topology, a common and practical setting in many faces-, hand-, and body-related applications.

item.title: tieval: An Evaluation Framework for Temporal Information Extraction Systems
item.description: All in all, these problems have limited the fair comparison between approaches and consequently, the development of temporal extraction systems.

item.title: An Efficient Drifters Deployment Strategy to Evaluate Water Current Velocity Fields
item.description: In this paper, we consider a common approach for water current prediction that uses Lagrangian floaters for water current prediction by interpolating the trajectory of the elements to reflect the velocity field.

item.title: Robust Human Identity Anonymization using Pose Estimation
item.description: Many outdoor autonomous mobile platforms require more human identity anonymized data to power their data-driven algorithms.

item.title: Learning to Perceive in Deep Model-Free Reinforcement Learning
item.description: We investigate whether a model with these characteristics is capable of achieving similar performance to state-of-the-art model-free RL agents that access the full input observation.

item.title: Predicting Hateful Discussions on Reddit using Graph Transformer Networks and Communal Context
item.description: We propose a system to predict harmful discussions on social media platforms.

item.title: RedMule: A Mixed-Precision Matrix-Matrix Operation Engine for Flexible and Energy-Efficient On-Chip Linear Algebra and TinyML Training Acceleration
item.description: The increasing interest in TinyML, i. e., near-sensor machine learning on power budgets of a few tens of mW, is currently pushing toward enabling TinyML-class training as opposed to inference only.
